comment: The generalized Pocklington's theorem. If ` N - 1 = A x. B ` where ` B < A ` , then ` N ` is prime if and only if for every prime factor ` p ` of ` A ` , there is an ` x ` such that ` x ^ ( N - 1 ) = 1 ( mod N ) ` and ` gcd ( x ^ ( ( N - 1 ) / p ) - 1 , N ) = 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Mar-2014.)
